Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: EithneBelfast
Reviews.Content: Very laid back and relaxing hotel. Rooms a little small but you really are only there to sleep. From 5-6 everyday day they have free wine on offer and free tea and coffee every morning. A continental breakfast is delivered every morning between 7-10. Lovely fire in the lobby and relaxing seats and couches were you can drink your own drinks and mingle with other guests. Staff extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tim257
Reviews.Content: What an awesome experience! The staff here was very laid back, but very accommodating. From the moment you step in to the lobby, you know you're in San Francisco! The decor is very Chic and the rooms are no exception! If this is your first trip to the city, I highly recommend this cozy hotel with a staff that truly enjoys what they do! I really felt right at home and there is great breakfast next door at the french cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JR86ch
Reviews.Content: Great location. Helpful staff. Wine hour offered opportunity to meet other guests. Tea/coffee in the morning, biscuits in the afternoon. Rooms are cosy but adequate. Free wifi. What more can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Triton”
Reviews.Author: Carl N
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. They upgraded us to the top floor on arrival. They had a wonderful wine hour and great guest to chat with. It was in a great location and close enough to the ballpark and shopping. They gave us a great recommendation for a spanish tappas dinner. Over all it was a great room, hotel, staff and trip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location/poor sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes1950
Reviews.Content: Great location at the gates of Chinatown. Hotel is currently being upgraded. Tour buses park right outside making checking in with a car and luggage very difficult. Friendly check in staff including dog. Bright carpets have a slightly halucinagenic effect. Room size was fine, however bathroom was very small and water pressure a bit lame. The airconditioning in the room was very noisy and windows would not open. Main gripe really is inadequate sound proofing. All hallway noise was audible. The cheap timber venetians did not block out light. Every fire engine, bus and garbage truck felt as though they were in the room. Bed and linen were fine...shame about the sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: 534TravelingMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter to celebrate her 40th birthday. We loved it. No car needed because it was so centrally located--short walks to Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero, Union Square, etc., and the staff had excellent advice on all sorts of things. They went out of their way to be a step above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Vibe and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DeDe333
Reviews.Content: Hotel Triton has an excellent location, fun vibe that our teenagers loved and friendly staff that make you feel at home. We literally looked out our window to see the gate for Chinatown (making for easy access to great food) and walked only a couple of blocks to some excellent shopping. With only a couple of blocks of walking you access the the cable car to the wharf and chocolate factory! The evening wine hour was a nice respite before charging out each night to find yet another culinary find - Little Italy was our favorite ... and even if you take a taxi there ($6.50), you can enjoy the 8 block walk back to work off the delicious dinner. No matter when we walked back in the door, Evan magically (according to our daughters) opened the door as if we were the most important folks in town. Mary was always at the ready with more recommendations - including her favorite dishes at the French restaurant next door (which also has some of the best croissants I've had outside of Europe! We definitely will recommend the Hotel Triton to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: davidden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 12 year old daughter. Had a great time. The location is great and so is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: colandchaz
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, great location...... Certainly different from the norm. Staff, usually very helpful. Rooms were big enough. Lack of services in the hotel but you kind of expect that in a city centre hotel. Our room was fairly high up and faced onto the alleyway which was not ideal. Everynight the local homeless would start rooting through the bins which created an awful amount of noise. The hotel staff have clearly received a lot of complaints about this in the past as they were neither helpful or polite. A decent hotel ruined by that one experience I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Below the Kimpton average”
Reviews.Author: cgoldsch
Reviews.Content: I always had a great experience at Kimpton hotels but I was underwhelmed with this one. The decoration is questionable. It really feels like they tried to put lipstick on a pig and tried to find savings in the process! Rooms are small and the corridor stinks like an old building. To be fair, the hotel was going thru renovation and maybe in a couple of months it won’t look as bad. In the past I stayed in both at the Kimpton Monaco and the Kimpton Harbor Court in San Francisco. I strongly recommend them over Kimpton Triton.

Reviews.Title: “there are better options”
Reviews.Author: myla2009
Reviews.Content: stayed here feb 2012 .. i dont think will do it again. very old hotel , rooms small the hallway pretty dark, for the same price you can get far better choices within the area. the only + part the staff much more helpful and amiable it was a relied.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience - Great Value, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: spatravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel in the hopes of avoiding the hassles of parking in downtown San Francisco. I selected their "Perfect Parking Package". From my very first call to make the reservation, I could tell this hotel was extremely guest friendly. They suggested I sign up for their guest loyalty program and gave me a $10 "Raid the bar" voucher and asked what location of room I enjoyed, what type of pillows etc. When I arrived, I was able to easily pull my car in front of the hotel. There was a baggage person to immediately unload my luggage for me and a driver to take my car to a secure location. I was greeted at the front desk for check in by one of the friendliest agents anywhere. I was allowed an early check in as we had made good time in traffic and had somewhere to be before the usual check in time. They noticed I was in their guest loyalty program and bumped me up to a nicer room at no charge. I was given a corner room, as preferred with an amazing view of the city. While settling into my room, I heard a knock at the door and there was a kind man bringing me the type of pillows I preferred. The room was super clean and there were niceties such as a robe to use. I wasn't sure I would like the "artsy" decor but it was great although I understand they are remodeling. I was invited to have warm cookies in the lobby and a complimentary wine tasting in the evening. There was coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning. The most amazing part of this hotel for me was that every single person who worked there was very interested in making my stay pleasant. The valet, the baggage man, the "pillow" man, Scott, the front desk manager and everyone else was so professional and friendly that I will never forget that place. It is right at the gates of China Town and there is a great Irish Pub just around the corner. It is close to everything I wanted to see and do, including booking a great facial at the Aveda Institute just around the corner. For the price, I expected a clean room and parking, what I ended up with was an unequaled experience from their amazing staff. I hope to return there and also visit the other Kimpton hotels when I travel, I have a feeling they have mastered the guest experience at each of their locations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: Great location with exceptional staff who were very friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations - we really loved our corner room and the price was great for what you get. The rooms are well decorated and fun. It was a great place to relax and have a romantic weekend. Absolutely no complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend living in SF. Location was great, easy access around SF. Nicely decorated, room was unique and the building had character. It's not a tower of 1,000 identical rooms typical of the big chains. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Valet parking at the hotel is $45/night but there's a public car park a block away that provides self-service parking for $35.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: MrsMVegas
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Triton was a truly incredible experience. The staff- particularly Vilen and Valerie, were exceptional. From the moment we arrived, they went above and beyond to provide us with the best service we have ever experienced anywhere. Each day we stayed, it just got better and and more personalized. Hotel Triton made us feel like real VIPs. Total rock stars! Beyond that, it was like staying with good friends-good friends who happen to own a hotel, are ridiculously generous and want to show you the best time ever. We can't stop talking about how great this hotel was and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the garbage trucks!”
Reviews.Author: bmh1207
Reviews.Content: The Triton was a big disappointment. Granted i took the lowest price room, but it was so small that the double bed was up against the was so i could only get into it on one side. But the real problem came at 3am when the garbage trus pulled up under my window and made enough noise to wake the dead for nearly a half an hour. The next day after I complained I was moved to a quiet and larger room at no extra cost. But the hotel obviously knows that certain rooms (I was in 322) will be disturbed and should at a minimum tell the guests and offer deep discounts to anyone who decide to stay there despite the noise.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way...”
Reviews.Author: 2justbreathe
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there for her b.day. We were treated better than family; surprise treats, cards, constant laughter. The windows open so we could hear the street sounds, cool robes, crazy fun colors, textures and located close to everything plus they allow dogs which is always a delight. Coffee is delivered to hotel by local roasters on bicycles; people there are gems. Kinda pricey but if you have to spend $, spend it there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: pileated11
Reviews.Content: Great place. Roomy rooms. Friendlly Service. Perfect Location.

Reviews.Title: “service and decor make it worth the price”
Reviews.Author: profegringo
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a little getaway and appreciated that this hotel offered a deal that included valet parking. Rooms are small, the norm in SF, but we appreciated that the decoration was creative and colorful. Staff was friendly and attentive. Little extras that were included in the bill were nice: free wifi, extra pillows, NY Times, wine and cookies in the afternoon, coffee in the morning. This hotel chain, which we knew from a previous trip to Portland, really tries to make your stay special. A little pricier than some other hotels, but worth it. Location is ideal (museums, shopping, chinatown). This was just the little escape we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: NatParkLvr
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Clean, nicely appointed rooms with comfortable beds and very good sound isolation. Attention to detail sets this apart. Great service, good quality tea & coffee in the lobby every morning, wine reception in evening, continental breakfast delivered to room with fresh muffins from restaurant next door. They even had Kimpton umbrellas available which everyone needed during our 4 night stay. My only recommendation for improvement is that they provide a small fresh squeezed OJ rather than large reconstituted OJ with breakfast. We'll look for Kimpton hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daniszcz
Reviews.Content: Great location with Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach nearby. The staff were so nice giving us great suggestions for a night on the town. The rooms were quirky, cute, and very comfortable. The wine hour is just the cherry on top. The food at The Café de la Presse was top notch. I just wish we stayed one more day in the City to enjoy relaxing at the hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ellebb
Reviews.Content: Its almost like being at a second home...easy to get to, access to lots of stuff. I've stayed at this hotel three times and it never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and different.”
Reviews.Author: megskel18
Reviews.Content: I am a Kimpton In Touch member and love staying at Kimpton hotels whenever possible. The service is always great, they are unique but always CLEAN! Staff is always helpful and freindly and laid back, not pretentious. I typically travel for work so usually miss the wine happy hour, but upon arrival they were just closing up and were sure to personally get me a glass while I was checking in. The location is great and the price is reasonable, the only downfall to the location is that it is a little noisy at night, but the hotel offers in room noise machines which helps alleviate the noise. The bathrooms were somewhat small as well, but as a single traveler this was fine for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty hotel that needs triple glazing”
Reviews.Author: chezz8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in march, the rooms are small, carpets are sticky with dirt, wood chip wallpaper with emulsion used. Tv remote control encrusted with food, bed OK. If you want to sleep don't take the rooms overlooking the road as the windows are third world specification. You will hear the drug addicts and drunks that hang around all night near the hotel and then waste collection vehicles and all times of the night. Was going to stay for two nights, after one sleepless night I dragged my bags to a proper hotel for the second night, you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Retro Fun in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Scribble96
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in San Francisco at the Triton and it's a fun, hip, cool, funky little hotel. The rooms are a little small, but they make use of every corner with hip and fun amenities. The service was great and everyone was very friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean. Everywhere you look, there's colorful art and unique stylings that make this a one-of-a-kind experience. You could tell that a lot of people just wanted to hang out in the lobby, have a drink and take it all in. If you want luxury, you might want to stay somewhere else. If you want a break from the ordinary, give the Triton a try. You might find yourself in a whole new state of mind when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great service!”
Reviews.Author: VballGal79
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel saying it's not the fanciest but it's quirky with a great location and friendly staff, and she was right! My boyfriend and I stayed here for only 1 night last year before a Thanksgiving visit with family outside of the city but we wished we could have stayed longer. It was walking distance to lots of restuarants and shopping, the staff was very friendly and the free wine hour was great. The room was a little small but the bed was very comfortable and the room quiet so given it's in the middle of the city this was fantastic for the price and convenience. Will def stay here again the next time I'm in SF!

Reviews.Title: “BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Triton for 4 nights for our 10th anniversary. I proactively told the hotel staff in advance of our special milestone. They went ABOVE & BEYOND by finding a special corner room for us on a higher floor and surprising us with complimentary roses, fresh raspberries, chocolates, champagne, and a personalized "Congratulations" card waiting for us in our room. We were blown away. The staff continued to meet all our needs and go out of their way to provide answers and solutions throughout ourstay. The hotel's location is ideal and is walking distance from cable car and streetcar stops, and many restaurants. Also, a Starbucks across the street, which my wife appreciated. Because of the way we did the city each day (early out and back after dinner) we didn't get to participate in the wine hour but I'm sure that would have been nice and relaxing. All in all, first class service in a funky, boutique setting. It exceeded all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: winifred t
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week end february 2012. small funky trendy hotel in great location.,near chinatown. felt safe to walk evenings. have stayed in all sorts of hotels but triton beats them all. enthusiastic staff,not fussing but ready for you to "just ask us" nothing is too much trouble, and we were really reluctant to leave.. free cookies in the afternoon, and guests invited to the lobby at 5pm for a free glass of wine and a chat. we dined at another nearby kimpton hote, and the same enthusiastic service was there too...oh, and sanfran wasla gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: courtaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within easy reach of the financial district, Chinatown, and Union Square. The hotel is designed to be funky but it still managed to look dated. It was late when we checked in the gentleman at the front desk was very cheerful and helpful. The room was clean and bed was comfortable (isn't that what we really want?). I was able to take advantage of wine hour and the host was very attentive and engaging. I briefly met the hotel mascot. He had a lot of energy and was being entertained by other dogs. Stayed in room 305 and had a good view of the entrance to Chinatown. The closet was a good size but the bathroom was a bit of a squeeze. It was clean so I was happy. Even though there was a block on the floor for electronic devices I would suggest bring your own power strip to make it easier to plug in items. Walking a few blocks through Chinatown put you in Little Italy. I suggest Stinking Rose for sure! Get the roasted garlic! Walking a few blocks up Sutter and Powell and hit stop at the Cable Car Cafe for breakfast. Its an unassuming place the breakfast is delicious!! The morning of check out was a fiasco for me - I inadvertantly put the wrong date down for SuperShuttle. The woman who was on staff at 5 in the morning on Feb 21st was phenomenal!! She took the time to help me find the issue with SuperShuttle and then found a car service for me that was less than taking a taxi. I apologize that I don't remember your name (all the stress) but you were AWESOME!!! Thank you!!! All in all - the hotel was good and the staff was GREAT! In the word's of Arnold "I'll be back....."

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton Fab Hotel ! This place was Funky and Cool”
Reviews.Author: Roadstraveledfar
Reviews.Content: Ok another fantastic stay at a Kimpton Hotel! I was met with a cool blast of color and when I got into the lobby there was a Tarot Card reading going on. As always the doors at these places are artwork in themselves! I had great service, a great time and wonderful accommodations. My only complain would be the tiny little elevator! I guess it gives it character..... The rooms are small, even with an upgrade but they are in the true spirit of Kimpton Boutique hotels. Wish they would get out to Vegas... so I can visit one there! Come with an appetite for authentic Chinese food because you are directly in front of the ornate entry to Chinatown!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice gem in the city!”
Reviews.Author: phillytraveler411
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and over a long weekend and enjoyed every minute. My check in person made life less painful. I was exhausted upon arrival and although my room wasn't ready he was very considerate. He made sure I was comfy, checked my luggage, and even volunteered to print a document I needed for the next day. (Thanks so much Kent!) I liked the hotel's entire vibe. The lobby was both calm and vibrant. Between appointments, I sat near the open fireplace and read. Their daily cocktail party was fun! On a quiet night, I spent time in a huge chair munching cookies and writing postcards. The staff greeted me each day with a warm smile. I found all the staff so very helpful -- providing great dining suggestions and help with transportation. They were never too busy to call a restaurant for me or plot out my desired route on a map. As others have mentioned, my room was indeed small. But I enjoyed it. It was impeccably clean and neat. My rainfall shower always had hot water. The room's desk provided a great workspace and the bed was super comfy. WiFi was a huge plus for me as I was able to find places and map routes without missing a beat. I also had some of the best meals nearby: Cafe de la Press was delicious. I also enjoyed La Boulange and sushi at Akiko. I found the hotel's proximity to the Ferry Building and Market Street a big help. I walked everywhere! Hotel Triton was the perfect home base. I'd stay there again and hope to do so again -- soon!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny yet very clean room in great location”
Reviews.Author: Tohono
Reviews.Content: My room was extremely tiny but I didn't mind as I didn't spend too much time in it:-) Great Wine Hour in the funky lobby. Extremely helpful and entertaining staff. The hotel is located across the Dragon Gate and surrounded by lots of restaurants and bars. I particularly enjoyed Café de la Presse and Gitane.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa M
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Triton for the 2nd time and enjoyed it even more this time! It's a fun, artsy place to stay. Location is fabulous, price is right and you feel welcome and comfortable from the moment you arrive. Can't wait for my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a friend while I was in town for a conference, and I was exceptionally pleased with my stay. The rooms were clean and I loved the funky decor. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The evening wine reception was a great way to meet fellow travelers, something I enjoyed very much. The location was perfect as well. overall, I couldn't have been more pleased with our stay, and I will most definitely stay at this hotel for any future travel to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mops1234
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Triton is located across the street from San Francisco's Chinatown. It is only a few blocks away from Union Square and many of the theatres. We requested early check in but our room was not ready. No problem, they took our bags and parked our car and off we went. When we returned, our room was ready. Comfortable room accommodations and "fun" decor! We enjoyed the Hotel Triton's no charge Wine hour from 5-6 p.m. and then went around the corner for dinner at Le Central. After dinner, a walk to the American Conservatory Theatre to see a play and then a nice walk back to the Hotel. The following day, we again were able to leave our bags and car, check out and still walk around the City some more. The Hotel staff was always more than accommodating and helpful. To top things off, after completing a survey, the Hotel Manager sent us a personal "thank you" email....impressive! We will definitely stay at the Hotel Triton again!

Reviews.Title: “San Fran Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ticket2Venture
Reviews.Content: I love the Kimpton hotel chain and I have stayed at many different hotels. My friend and I just returned from San Francisco and like usual, the staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean. My only negative comment is that the bathrooms are too small and the rooms itself are a bit small. Especially if you are having more than 2 people in a room. I would rather stay in a larger room so there is space to put your luggage etc. In addition, China Town is nearby so a bit noisy if you are facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, perfect location and great value (through AA.com)”
Reviews.Author: Pacman1825
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, perfect location and great value (through AA.com). Will come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: MendocinoInnkeeper
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what others have said: friendly, helpful, accommodating staff; the best location imaginable in SF...adjacent to all the cool and unique stores and great restaurants, and at the gate to Chinatown; quirky pop culture decor that works; VERY quiet. Our room was large, two closets and a nice-sized bath. Relative to what you receive, the rates represent an excellent value in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineD
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on price and couldn't have been more pleased. I booked it to take my 6 year old daughter ice skating at Union Square just after the holidays. The location was amazing and just a quick walk to Union Square and directly across the China Gate. The staff was so welcoming and because of being a Kimpton member (join free on line) our room was upgraded and we received a free mini bar credit for $10.00. They also sent a sweet note to my daughter to enjoy her visit. The decor is very whimsical and unique, perfect for myself and 6 year old daughter. The rooms are a bit small but that's downtown SF. By far, the most impressive service was upon check out. My large SUV was valet parked. It was taking more than 10 minutes for my car to be brought around. I heard a manager talking with someone at the garbage. As it turns out, my battery had died. In just a short while, they were able to jump it. Because of the short wait, they comped my valet parking fees and mini bar charge. Very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Weird but satifying”
Reviews.Author: JurgenRaedts
Reviews.Content: Someone else booked this hotel for me. It struck me as weird. It's definitely different from any place I've stayed before. But staff is friendly, rooms are very clean, it's located close to Market Street. I received a free upgrade to a top story suite. It was so big I could have had a party there :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: penwill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Triton in July and had a nice stay. The room was small but we were only in there for a short time. It was comfortable though. Nice decor and bedding. The room was quiet too. The location was great. It is just outside of China Town and a short walk to the Embarcadero or Union Square. The restaurant on the corner was wonderful!!! We came for the Giants game and walked to the ball park but it was quite a walk. It was a beautiful day and night so we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “another very satisfying stay at the Triton”
Reviews.Author: tsiesfeld
Reviews.Content: When I am in SF (about 6 or 7 times a year), I stay at a Kimpton Hotel and always try to stay at the Triton. I really like the casual yet careful attention I get. The staff is great, the location perfect for me, and the rooms comfortable and easy to work in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service is excellent. Lively and colorful accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: faroutley
Reviews.Content: Valerie at the front desk is awesome. The little extra things that the staff members did made our stay very special and will have us returning to this hotel again and again. Fun hotel, great location and comfortable beds. See you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and feel, but small”
Reviews.Author: GoingTravelingU2
Reviews.Content: Right at the gates to CHinatown, I love this location. Staff was friendly, and kids loved the free hot cocoa in the lobby. Rooms are well appointed, but small, so don't plan to spend a lot of time lounging around in them. Some street noise, but to be expected in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place, great character, but a little creaky”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBCguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Service is charming and excellent and they even had a cute little dog helping at the entrance. Love the stye and quirkiness, beds were very comfortable and the free wine at 5pm was nice, although surprised it was a Chilean wine rather than featuring a more local variety. Even a cheap local variety would make sense given the proximity to Sonoma. My only issue with this place is that it is clearly a refurb of a rather old place, but it is kind of a half refurb. Elevators are old (no big deal) and the rooms are on the smaller side. We had an upgrade to a King and there wasn't much room around the bed. The bathroom is partly in the room itself. That is, the toilet and bath are in a separate room, but the sink is right in the room, which is a bit odd. The air conditioner is the type that is a box in the window and the windows were not that sound proofed. As a result, I heard a lot of noise outside which woke me up. I'm not exactly a light sleeper, so this was a fair bit of noise on both nights and we were on the 6th floor. Overall, I did like it for it's character and location though.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay at hotel triton”
Reviews.Author: funluvin99
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for 2 nights as part of a week long California trip. The hotel was ideally located - having visited fishermans wharf we were really glad not to be staying in what felt like Blackpool! Hotel was clean and reasonably well maintained, staff friendly and very helpful, it doesn't have a bar but given its location it really doesn't need one. There are a number of bars less than 2 minutes away. One bonus is that there is a hop on hop off open top bus that stops right outside the hotel, it was $40 but two days so well worth it. Also a starbucks right across the road and its located at the gates at China town. Overall would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The staff are super friendly and very helpful. The decor is funky and interesting. It's also in a great neighborhood. You can walk out the door and straight into Chinatown or down to the Financial District or Union Square. I'm a fan of Kimpton Hotels and their free wine hours from 5-6pm and the Triton carries on this fine Kimpton tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love Hotel Triton!”
Reviews.Author: Brian J
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to San Francisco was approximately 5 years ago. We stayed at a hotel in the financial district. Since then, we've only stayed at Hotel Triton. While we are fans of Kimpton properties and their InTouch program, Hotel Triton is our absolute favorite. It's a boutique experience with amazing personal touches. We love their afternoon cookies and especially their wine happy hour. Their entire staff is so customer focused, but the front desk, Evan at the front door and Romeo the hotel pooch make the experience enjoyable, friendly and welcoming every time. Rooms are on the smaller side but fun, very clean, have great bath products and are the best value in Union Square in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Hcir1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Triton. The bed was comfortable and the sheets and pillowcases were of high quality. Housekeeping were very quick to respond to any request. It seems like they really do care about the comfort of their guests. The location is great if you are looking to stay in the heart of downtown San Francisco. We will stay there again if we find ourselves back in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wherefore art thou Romeo”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: Romeo is the name of their four legged ambassador. He greets you at the door, is adorable, and puts you in a good mood from the moment you step in the door. The staff is attentive and courtious. The rooms are unique and campy with beautiful hand blown lighting. Best of all, the location is right next to the financial district and at the entrance to Chinatown. If you want older hotel charm that has been modernized in only the best ways, then the Hotel Triton, or any Kimpton hotel in the city, is for you. This was my first stay and I hope to return again in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - I highly recommend the Triton”
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler I spend 200+ nights a year in hotel rooms. This past December I traveled to San Francisco to spend the holidays with my sons and daughters families. My daughter made reservations for me at the Triton and told me that I would love it. My first reaction was "Meh...Just another hotel". But once I arrived I found that the staff of the Triton makes it a truly remarkable hotel. Each of the rooms are unique. A friend of mine told me that she stayed in the "Jerry Garcia Room". While I was checking out the desk clerk was suggesting that a family with young children stay in the Hagen-Daas Ice cream room (I'm not sure what that is, but I am going to book it next time I go to SF. They have a wine tasting every night from 5 - 6. When I mentioned to the desk clerk that I was sorry that I kept missing, it she had samples of wine sent to my room. The best day though was Christmas morning. When I went to leave the hotel for breakfast, the doorman was a small dog named Romeo. Romeo had been trained to hit the handicap button on the door to open it. When I came back from breakfast Romeo & I had a grand time playing fetch and watching him do tricks. After playing with Romeo, I went back to my room and found a bag of cookies left by housekeeping as a Christmas present. Although my room was small it was nicely appointed, but the staff made the whole visit a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-Holiday Escape to SF”
Reviews.Author: Leigh L
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and her friend, my husband and I all took a short vacation over winter break to San Francisco and stayed at the Hotel Triton. It was a return stay for me as I love the hotel's prime downtown location, friendly staff, happy hour, and fun decor. Best of all, the hotel is so easy to get to from Highway 101. I love that they have complimentary copies of The New York Times and not USA Today. And, the almond croissants at the cafe next door are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Mad Hatter's closet hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlstar28
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying here booked by a corporate travel agency. The lobby is like full of the Mad Hatter from Alice in Wonderland's fabrics and dark. Elevators (2) are super tiny and is like riding the Cash Cab with different coloured ceiling lights. Hotel rooms are super tiny smaller than rooms I've stayed at in Hong Kong (where real estate is tight). First room was a definite no go where bed was a weird twin and a half on a weird upholstered bed. Bathroom is a closet and can't shut the door and sit on toilet at same time. Rooms have a funky smell too. Upgraded to a king bed which is more normal but the other attributes remain the same, small, funky, weird smell. There are also Fred Flintstone random bathrobe in the teensy closet. Location is all right but at this price would rather stay at a chain hotel. Fact that it's pet friendly is concerned too as dirty pets may have been in the bed...ew. Stay away if you have chain standards. I even stayed at off beat hotels in China and they were bigger and not so weird and creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Happiness”
Reviews.Author: Deb B
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel and wonderful staff. The room I stayed in was very spacious and extremely clean and comfortable. The location is also top notch, just a very short walk to the happenings and shopping in Union Square, and Chinatown is, literally, just out the front door. I highly recommend this hotel for people looking for a great SF hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Time at Triton”
Reviews.Author: Saltrat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 5 nights at the Hotel Triton in early December 2011. We loved the place. To start things off right, we received a complimentary upgrade to a king room on arrival. The room, like the hotel, was funky and colorful, with a comfortable bed. The wine and hot toddies at 5:00 each afternoon was a nice touch, and the coffee and tea in the morning were both excellent. They even had hot chocolate with whipped cream and sprinkles. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Finally, the location of the hotel couldn't be better. It's right at the entrance to Chinatown, and therefore just a quick walk to North Beach. It's also very close to Union Square shopping. We'll absolutely be back to the Triton.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!! Bachelorette Party Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Triton gets 5 stars in my book! I'm a seasoned traveler and I would rate Hotel Triton as among the top boutique hotels I've ever stayed at. I am a SF resident but stayed at HT for one night recently in honor of my close girlfriend's bachelorette party. HT was perfect for our event: unique, aesthetically breathtaking, friendly staff abounded. The staff knew why my friends and I were there and they made all kinds of effort to make our time there fun and special. There were complimentary bottles of champagne and wine in our room, a handwritten welcome note, and chocolates waiting for the bride to be in her suite. We were fortunate to be able to take advantage of some excellent holiday specials which made our suites more than affordable. I would also highly recommend the Hagen Daaz Suite. All you can eat, any flavor Haggen Daas!! For me, the way we were treated by all staff members was the best part of our stay. Everyone was friendly and welcoming - we felt like we were staying at a friend's or relative's home instead of a large, anonymous chain hotel. I love Hotel Triton!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: kate c
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times, even though we are local, to gather with friends for a night in the City. It's always friendly, unpretentious, and a pleasure to stay at. We especially love that the hotel is dog friendly and that there is a nightly wine reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and vibe”
Reviews.Author: SeskaLien
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for an annual geology conference with another person at the recommendation of a friend of mine who stays at Hotel Triton every year during the conference. Since he has immaculate taste, I figured it was a good choice, and I was not let down. The location is great, easy walking distance to just about anything you might want to see, including the cable cars and BART if you want to get beyond walking distance. Chinatown being literally right across the street is a huge plus: Quick access to amazing food! My friend and I invited colleagues back to the hotel for the nightly wine happy hour, and many of them were impressed with the hotel and our description of the amenities. Sure, the rooms are small, but when you are in SF you should be out enjoying the city and not spending much time in your room anyway! :) The "Zen Den" room with a double bed was the perfect size for my friend and I sharing a bed; we didn't find the size of the room to be an issue at all. The shower was really nice, the room was clean, and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful when we had questions. Room service was even happy to make a change to one of the items on their menu to make it vegetarian for me, and the food was great. Since we stayed over 3 nights we got 15% off, and so between two people the room rate was entirely reasonable. Hotel Triton will likely be my annual stop during this conference from now on, and it probably will be for a few more geologists as well after the folks we brought by enjoyed it so much!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: steve s
Reviews.Content: We met up with my daughters & their spouses for a great weekend. Friday evening after dinner and beer at a nearby pub we decided we wanted rootbeer floats. The night desk clerk heard us and said she would be right back. She came back with a list of ice creams that she offered us but didn't have rootbeer. We went next door and bought rootbeer while she delivered a pint of vanilla, a pint of cabernet and one other type of Haagen Dazs. She brought 6 spoons and said enjoy. Such a pleasant surprise and the type of service we saw during our stay

Reviews.Title: “A great place for your four legged friend too.”
Reviews.Author: gr8eats88
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with Fido too. Very dog friendly hotel ad with biscuits treats and water bowl upon entering. I had to bring fido here during the summertime and will do it again. Staffs are friendly and attentive all you need to do os pick the phone tell them what you need then consider it done. Its noisy during weekends so get the highest level as possible if not head over to walgreens and get earplugs rated at 33db level trust me you will need it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky hotel is a great value”
Reviews.Author: DBAat2C
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels and this one is no different. Very welcoming staff - I was upgraded to a king corner room with a view of Coit Tower upon check in and given a $10 "raid the minibar" coupon! Can you say free cocktail? Fun, funky decor throughout the hotel, free wireless and plush amenities - all for a great rate compared to other hotels in the area. Walking distance to financial district and Union Square. This will be my go to hotel for business in downtown SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great staff...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scoobywrx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 720 on the 7th floor. It was perfect, huge room, spotlessly clean with funky decor. I have only good things to say about the hotel. Staff were really cool, loved Romeo wandering around reception. Location is great with China Town entrance right across the road and Union square so close. We arrived on Thanksgiving and the reception had done up a printed list of restaurants in the near vicinity that were open, saved us having to find somewhere...nice touch. Defo be back next time I'm in San Fran :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Youwheel
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a friday. The hotel was very unique and is located in an excellent location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Also very gay friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdmacd62
Reviews.Content: This is a neat hotel, decor is colorful and rooms very comfortable. The best part to me was the team working here. Very helpful and friendly. We were welcomed and remembered each time we entered the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Weird but Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolas617
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have a better location. Hotel is sort of a low-end version of a W hotel. Most of the eclectic decor works alright for the theme. The building is old and not the greatest - so these folks have done their best. Rooms are small - but reasonably decorated and bed was comfy. People were generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel = Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PDove
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a deal with the flights, and it couldn't have been more enjoyable. Due to a late flight, we arrived for check in very late, but the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. We were on the second floor, and the room was much much bigger than I had expected. The decor was fantastic, and the room even included a sunken jazcuzzi room, complete with a TV, wooden paneling, beaded curtain and surrounding mirrors! We were given $10 to go towards the mini-bar which was well spent. I slept fine, but my boyfriend thought it was quite noisy and the room almost too dark due to the black-out curtains. I didn't hear any noise, but being in the center of downtown, it would be expected anyway. The hotel was in the perfect location as we could pop back between excursions, as it's close to everything. We ate at several of the excellent bars and restaurants nearby, all within a couple minutes walk. The free wine tasting in the evening was great. The valet was extremely helpful and friendly, - and we enjoyed watching his dog that runs around the lobby and can open the automatic front doors! Too cute. They offer breakfast by room service, but with Cafe de la Presse just next door, it isn't even needed. Overall a great stay, I'd love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A San Francisco Gem”
Reviews.Author: born2bwild
Reviews.Content: Great location, just outside of Chinatown and close to Union Square and the Financial District. Modern rooms, interesting and colorful with a unique lobby. Friendly staff and excellent service. Great value. The beds are comfortable. This is a boutique hotel I never tire of staying at. The Cafe Presse restaurant in the lobby is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, perfect for my business trip”
Reviews.Author: dani42379
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. First, the staff at check-in were super friendly and helpful with all of my questions. The hotel hosts a wine reception, common to Kimptons. However, on the evening I arrived, there was an extended reception with a local artist. Fantastic. Also, the hotel teams up with the nearby Lululemon for a running/yoga evening. Also fantastic; these sort of touches make a place unique and memorable. The hotel is swank and has personality, which is welcome when your business trips usually involve the ivory and beige, everyday, nothing special hotels. The room was a regular king, perfect sized for me and would also likely be good for my spouse and I. My only wish was that the fitness room had another treadmill. The hotel and its staff are great and the location just makes the whole place even better. It's close to so many things and near many transportation choices. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand B
Reviews.Content: A nice boutique hotel in San Francisco, nicely situated near Chinatown and Union Square. If you're looking for something a little different this is it. "Hip" art-deco design, with interesting quirks, like a dog "mascot" and free cookies. If you're looking for a corporate 5-star hotel, this isn't it. The rooms were a little on the small side, but not bad for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Well sited”
Reviews.Author: Beaver25
Reviews.Content: Very art deco flavoured hotel, room was good and clean although being at front of hotel it was extremely noisy, am very surprised they don't have double glazing installed as constantly woken up at 6am by traffic outside. Ideally situated for exploring Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf etc, Union Square. It is so easy to get around by bus in San Francisco so no excuse not to see everything. Had tea and coffee in lobby in morning and wine in evening. Shame there were no tea making facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I can remember”
Reviews.Author: jasag00
Reviews.Content: A small art deco hotel with immaculate customer service, right at the gate of Chinatown. Great restaurants nearby, and a short walk to Union Square. Can say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kkmengland
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the price, location, and reviews and we were not disappointed! When we checked in, we were greeted by friendly staff, Romeo (the adorable hotel dog), and a complimentary glass of wine since it was time for the evening wine tasting in the lobby. The lobby and rooms look exactly like the pictures. We requested a high floor to escape the noise from the busy street below and our room was virtually silent. The hotel is only a few blocks away from the BART which came in handy when it was time to head to the airport. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: KathyRome
Reviews.Content: I travel very frequently, and I think the Triton is my favorite hotel that I've stayed at. We stayed in a king room on the 5th floor overlooking the China Town gate. Other reviewers have complained about hearing the trash pick-up in the morning, but I'm not sure what they were expecting. The hotel is located in the center of SF, in the China Town / Financial district, and of course trash gets picked up! Whenever you stay in the center of a city this is a fact of life. It didn't bother us at all, we went right back to sleep. The view and location made it worth it. We walked almost everywhere - all through China Town, to Fisherman's Wharf and the Alcatraz cruises, to the farmer's market at the Ferry Building, to Union Square, etc. For the few areas that were not within walking distance, we just hopped on the MUNI trolley. Also, the beds are insanely comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and helpful. I brought my husband there as a surprise birthday present, and prior to the weekend the general manager, Antonio, helped me plan our stay and dinner reservations. Antonio was amazing (Thanks Antonio!!). He even had a bottle of wine in our room upon check-in for my husband's birthday. I am sure we will be returning to San Francisco in the future, and we will definitely stay at the Triton again. After this experience, we will probably seek out other Kimpton hotels when we travel as well. The hotel has a great decor, great beds, great location, and amazing service/staff.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to SF”
Reviews.Author: BeachWalker143
Reviews.Content: The Triton was perfect for me. It is close to so many things. The room was nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. The "Pop Culture" theme is great. Compliments to Coco Chanel, Katy Perry and Rocky Balboa (the alter egos of staff members).

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely delightful city hotel experience - not perfect, but darn close.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie W
Reviews.Content: I was attending a training session in San Francisco and was overwhelmed with the choices and prices for hotels in the financial district. Thankfully, the training center had a negotiated rate with the Hotel Triton that made it affordable for my budget. From the time of reservation, everything was lovely, smooth, friendly and positive. I was greeted warmly at check in and it was evident that the staff is excellent and very well trained. I had requested a quiet room (in a city, I know..) but was given 703 and it was actually very quiet. I slept better here than I have in suburban hotels elsewhere. On my first day, I stopped at the front desk to get a map and the staff was literally tripping over each other to assist me. There was coffee and tea each morning and a wine reception each evening that I did not partake in. I wish that I could give this hotel the very highest rating, but sadly, I cannot. I will give them straight A's for customer service, staff attitude, location and the like, but the hotel itself is showing it's age. The room was large enough for one person, but would have been tight for two - there was evidence that the floor had not been recently cleaned - just some crumbs and not a big deal, but unfortutunately, not an outstanding rating for clean. The tub was slow to drain, but again, this is an older building that has been nicely restored. The bathroom was small, but functional, with newer counters and the like. There was a nice robe and a hairdryer in the room - nice touches. Because it was my first stay, I was given a $10 credit for the mini bar which yielded a large bottle of water and a package of gourmet gummy bears. The room was maintained in an adequate manner each day - the mirror on the bathroom door was not cleaned and my towel was not replaced - very minor things, and not issues, but something to keep the rating away from excellent. Overall, I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel and would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Triton saved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 2 week rail vacation. First stop in Glazier National Park. I had an accident which required foot surgery and unable to walk. We decided to continue on to Porlland where we stayed in the Monaco then onto San Francisco's Triton. Both hotels were extremely accomadating. Hotel Triton upgraded us to a handicap suite and also provided a motorized scooter for use during my stay. I was able to see all the sights. The staff was wonderful. Can't wait to go back when I can truly enjoy all that San Francisco has to offer. If not for the accommodations provided, the decision to continue our vacation could have been disasterous. Thank you Triton. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagance at budget prices”
Reviews.Author: lorisgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a business trip, for a week. I was nothing short of impressed with the room, staff, location and services. It's right on the entrance to Chinatown, which means it's in the heart of the Financial District, providing easy transportation to any part of SF. It's also on the flat side of the city, so if you're not a fan of the ups and downs, you can have your fun the easy way. Close to subway stops, many buses, the busy Market Street and Union Square, not to mention the trams that go up and down the hills. The staff was the most helpful I've ever encountered, and they are able to provide you with many things for free, such as feminine hygiene products, toothpaste, and so on. You just ask. The room and the lobby were an entire new experience. Certainly the hotel with the most character I've ever stayed at. The lobby is filled with extravagant furniture that I just wish I could take home, and the room is nothing like any regular chain you've ever seen: blue walls, zebra-patterned headboard and so on. The place was spotless, and they have free wifi for anyone, as long as you create a login (you can use it in any Kimpton hotel). The wifi reception was a bit spotty, but for the price, I could hardly complain. I've stayed at 4-stars that had no wifi and cost twice as this one. Staff was great in recommending places to eat at odd hours and arranging city tours. Oh, and they have free wine tasting every afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Bubblysophia
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here and would go back in a heart beat. The location is perfect. Not too far from the shops, the great restaurants and only a 20 minute walk away from Fisherman's Wharf. Having our tarot cards read before going out for a meal was a novel experience. Not many hotels in the world that offer that! All the staff were knowledgable, friendly and kind. They all went out of their way to treat you like a friend that they'd welcomed into their home. Their dining recommendations are worth taking note of too. Our favourites were Scoma in Sausolito, Sears Fine Foods for breakfast and John's steak house in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: cilc213
Reviews.Content: A conveniently situated hotel right next to the Dragon's gate entrance to Chinatown. The rooms were fun with interesting paintings and a very comfortable bed. The hotel staff gave the best service I experienced on my three week trip to America. They were helpful, warm and friendly. I appreciated the free coffee in the morning and the complimentary drink in the evening. A great experience. It was expensive though. I paid £120 per night for a room, This is better if there are two of you, £60 each.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel - Stop 1”
Reviews.Author: Fats25
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from UK this was our first port of call. +ves - Staff and facilities were very good, enjoyed the coffee and tea in the mornings, and rooms were nice and clean. -ves - Room was small, and bed was a bit weird! A little bit like a daybed - but was comfortable enough. Also unfortunately for us, the room overlooked an alleyway where the garbage was located, and although there was no unpleasant smell from there, the bins were collected around 03:00/04:00 in the morning, and made a hell of a noise. Bad luck on the room we were allocated, but overall the experience (our first at a Kimpton) was pleasant, and based on this experience we booked another Kimpton for later in the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: adrianatofu
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Triton for a week-long vacation in SF. The price for the hotel was originally a little outside our budget, but overall it was worth it and I'm glad we chose to stay here. The location was great, close to all major transportation we needed (including several bus lines, metro, BART) and there is a lot to see/shop/eat within walking distance. Hotel staff were curteous and very helpful, rooms were clean, pleasant and comfortable. The building is not the newest (but none in the area are) and you can see the age of the building, but all considered, the hotel has done a fairly good job at keeping it in decent shape. Regarding reviews that criticize the noise level and security of the area - be aware it IS a busy tourist spot and most of the buildings around are older (which means less noise reduction mechanisms built-in). To me, it is natural that such a busy area that attracts not only tourists and other business activities would be noisy -- I don't enjoy loudness but it is normal and to be expected. It is true that oftentimes you can hear the traffic outside but I'm a sound sleeper and that didn't bother me. Regarding security, again, the area has high foot traffic of ALL sorts: tourists, businesspeople, students, bums, etc., but I personally didn't feel endangered while walking in the neighborhood. Be a smart tourist! (avoid darker areas, don't walk alone, don't have expensive gadgets hanging out, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jkdaves
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a few blocks from Union Square and located at the gates to China Town. Close to everything. Great staff. Pet Friendly. Wine tasting from 5-6 each day. Rooms are small, but efficient and comfortable. No restaurant or bar attached to hotel but one on either side. The Irish Bank is around the corner, great food and atmosphere. One of our favorite Irish bars in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, great location, awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: saltwhistler11
Reviews.Content: Just completed a business trip in SF and spent two nights at Hotel Triton. Love hanging out in the lobby, very cool vibe, good music, they play movies, have a nice coffee bar in the morning and wine tastings in the evening. I stayed in a King Executive Suite which again was very hip in it's decor. The one caution is to avoid rooms that face the alley as every early morning there is a trash truck that makes a lot of noise emptying dumpster. Otherwise, this is a great place. Right next to the entrance of chinatown, lots of shopping and near Union Square. The staff is casual, cool, and friendly. I will be back my next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room on tour”
Reviews.Author: PhilBurnett
Reviews.Content: Just returned from tour of Western USA, spending 3 nights at Triton.Having read previous reviews was expecting small bedroom but was suprised just how small. Well decorated but hardly room to open a suitcase. Coffee and Tea in lobby was a bonus, as was the wine tasting in the afternoon. Comfortable double beds, but very few, if any, twins as requested. Location excellent with good Irish Bar next door with good food, and easy access to China Town and Union Square. All in all a good hotel spoilt by undersized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanhand43
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Triton for 4 nights in September. Super room staff could not have been more friendly or helpful even had a dog as the Hotel Mascot unusual touch. Decor unusual but tasteful. Location perfect for Cable cars Restaurants shopping & sightseeing. Chinatown on the doorstep.Wine tasting between 5 & 6pm a bonus Would have no hesitation in recommending hotel. Ali G

Reviews.Title: “True San Francisco Experience”
Reviews.Author: MC_Bos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in SF for a meeting. It's a funky, fun place. The lobby feels like something out of a Dr. Seuss hotel, but the rooms are comfortable, and have a lot of character. The staff were all very friendly, and the location is fantastic - near Union Square and within easy walking distance of the Montgomery St. BART stop. The only warning is that if you're someone who doesn't like a lot of visual stimulation (decor involves a lot of artfully mis-matched prints and bright colors), the rooms might be a tiny bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed // We Won't Return I'm Afraid”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: Let's get the positives in first - this hotel is in a great location, close to attractions and is easy to find. Taxi drivers know it which is always a bonus. The nearest cable car stop isn't too far away and the city sightseeing hop on / hop off buses stop right outside. There are plenty of decent shops and bars close by and there's a Starbucks opposite if that's what you need to start your day. There's also a bistro on the side of the building which served decent food and drinks. The lobby is great - it's well designed and has a warm, friendly and welcoming feel when you first arrive. It was bustling and there was always plenty going on. I'm afraid that's pretty much where the positives end. The staff were friendly but not overly helpful, we had an issue with our booking that wasn't handled well by the hotel team - our booking via Expedia didn't correspond with the booking they had received and as the hotel was full we were stuck with a small twin room on the third floor, rather than a king suite. Not the end of the world but it wasn't our fault and after a long drawn out conversation, we turned down the offer a bottle of wine in the cramped bedroom and accepted their offer of a complimentary breakfast next morning. Not what we had booked, or paid for or expected. Maybe not the hotel staff's fault but certainly not mine either and I expected better handling of the situation by the staff, especially based on Kimptons reputation. I'm not one for complaining - anything for an easy life in fact - but this wasn't on. It wouldn't have been so bad if the third floor we were stuck with didn't smell so bad - kinda like how your grandmothers house might smell, y'know stale overcooked cabbage. We couldn't wait to leave if I'm honest. There were venetian blinds on the window that didn't keep the light out, the air conditioning unit was incredibly noisy and the sink wasn't in the bathroom it was in the bedroom which was both very odd and became an irritant. The beds were uncomfortable and needed changing and I'd have been more comfortable sleeping on a sack of potatoes than using the pillows. Maybe we were spoiled having just stayed at the brand new Aria Hotel in Las Vegas but this room was $60 more per night than we'd paid there and to be totally honest, if we'd only paid $60 p/night at Triton, we'd have felt that too expensive. The free internet access wasn't strictly accurate, you had to register in order to get it. Not the free high speed service we had experienced at other SF hotels. Who wants to register? Just let me get online. So, all in all if your choice of hotel is more about comfy beds than artwork on the walls of the lobby, prefer a pet-free hotel and staff that put the needs of guests first, you might wish to stay elsewhere, but to be balanced, if you want a hotel in a decent location, a nice lobby with a dog to greet you and guest house style rooms with lumpy pillows, book away, i doubt you'll be disappointed. Either way, we certainly won't return as we now know there are many other, better hotels in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful with Lots of Character- Loved It”
Reviews.Author: iheartNY02
Reviews.Content: Although our room was very small, we loved being RIGHT across the street from China town and very close to practically everything. The lobby was incredibly whimsical and I especially enjoyed the afternoon complimentary tea and lemonade in the afternoons on their comfy, colorful couches and there was always a movie going.... from Moulin Rouge to Alice in Wonderland. Movie choices had imagery that mimicked the style and design of the lobby-- clever. Staff was always very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here often.”
Reviews.Author: SNoon4056
Reviews.Content: The corporate rate we have is amazing. The service is great. The people are very friendly. I enjoy the crazy decor in the lobby. The rooms are always clean and I really appreciate the eco-friendly work that Kimpton is doing. The desks, sadly, are propped up next to the AC, so you'll be tragically cold while attempting to work. Not the most comfortable for business travelers, but you can make do. Lots of pluses! Loved the Hagen Daz suite, complete with free ice cream. And the Jerry Garcia suite!

Reviews.Title: “Funky darling hotel in heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: Jaime80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip this summer. The hotel is in an excellent location-- right at the steps of Chinatown (the gates), walking distance to shops and restaurants (it is flanked between a cafe and a wine bar). The hotel itself is spunky and unique, full of different colors and styles not typical in your standard hotel. The room was very nice and I appreciated the sound machine in the room that muffled traffic noise with the sound of crashing waves. I recommend requesting a room on a higher floor for noise reasons. Don't miss the complimentary wine cocktail hour in the afternoon. My only disappointment with this hotel is a few weeks after my stay they charged me an extra $200 because of their own mistake, which was a bit of a hassle to clear up. Don't imagine that is a common experience though.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps its appeal throughout the years”
Reviews.Author: seattleeastbound
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel over a decade ago, and on a recent trip back to San Francisco, immediately thought of this gem. The decor is fun and eclectic. The service is impecable - they always go above and beyond. The room choices are fun and meet a variety of needs. And it's a pet-friendly, eco-friendly hotel downtown. Room service is available from the adjacent which we found to be delicious and reasonably priced. Overall, I would recommend this hotel very highly, it has only gained appeal over time.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK for a Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: This is a very boutiquish hotel with funky decor. The hotel rooms are pretty small with not much storage space. The desk was a bit small but adequate for doing work. The TV was nice with a somewhat decent amount of channels. The bed was pretty comfortable, but nothing great, and the air conditioner worked fairly well. The wireless internet here is very inconsistent. It kept dropping out frequently, but when it did work the speeds were decent. The bathroom was small, but the shower was nice. Overall this is an alright hotel. Nothing great here, but it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: araybin
Reviews.Content: This was a great boutique hotel. The room was very clean, modern furniture and decor, and the staff was extremely friendly. The location was great to Chinatown and shopping. The price was right as well for everything that was given. We would absolutely stay here again or at another hotel in a different city.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed so we won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: twiggy_3
Reviews.Content: Great location for China Town and unusual decor. Liked coffee and drinks in foyer.But... Very tiny rooms, water took ages to drain away from basin. Unhelpful staff when I was trrying to get the telephone line activated in my room. It took three trips in tiny lift to reception who eventually told me " the phone probably doesn't work in your room." and that was that. Our room was not cleaned until I asked at 4.30pm- we had to leave and walk around for a bit. Again the reception seemed convinced that I had out a do not disturb sign on the door - which I hadn't. No apology. Very different service to that in L.A..

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilytriptoUSA
Reviews.Content: Family of four who stayed at Hotel Triton for four nights in August at the start of our Californian trip. Hotel is in a good location and most staff were friendly. Emailed ahead to ask for a quiet room and this was arranged as we had a room on the 7th floor and heard very little noise from the street. Quirky hotel with a nice atmosphere. Wine tasting hour was enjoyable and a nice touch. Rooms small and when luggage in the room for a family it was cramped but beds and pillows were very comfy. Some mix up over our booking including continental breakfast when we first arrived and this was still not sorted by the next morning however, this was rectified soon after. Concierge staff were very friendly, along with Romeo (dog). All in all a good hotel. Would recommend for a couple but rooms not really big enough for family.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: buttercupnewyork
Reviews.Content: My 17 yr old daughter and myself spent 5 nights at the hotel and enjoyed everything about it. The staff could not of been more helpful and friendly. The atmosphere was very relaxed and the continental breakfast, free coffee, cookies and wine made it very homely. The location is idea for getting around with the cable car at Powell St and the Bart only a short walk away. Having China town on your door step was great, very handy for a excellent takeout. I would highly recommend the hotel and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel and we liked it”
Reviews.Author: tnelson5x5
Reviews.Content: Right in the Heart of San Fran. and a great staff......

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: jdub89
Reviews.Content: I like the Kimpton hotels, in general - a great mix of value and personality. The Triton is directly across from Chinatown's Dragon Gate and is a nice base in the lowlands of the financial district. We had a corner room on an upper floor. It was clean, nicely decorated, with a smallish bathroom. There is a nice wine bar next door and breakfast can be had at the cafe on the corner. I enjoyed free wifi with their Kimpton loyalty program. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel-ideally located”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl077
Reviews.Content: Located right at the entry to China town and within walking distance of shopping, Ferry bldg (Farmer's market is located there and is not to be missed-also a great Vietnamese restaurant called Slanted Door), great restaurants---try the many restaurants on Beldin Lane with outdoor dining.....no car needed...Love this small hotel with a evening wine hour, morning coffee, and comfortable beds. The decor is trendy, staff is welcoming and atmosphere is friendly. Local papers and NY Times in lobby each morning. It is my favorite hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location great, price a little steep”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a brief vacation to the West Coast and we really did enjoy the experience. This hotel is located on Bush & Grant, right next to the entrance to Chinatown. It's also near the fancy shopping district, so if you're visiting San Fran to shop for high-end fashion and merchandise, you're in the right spot. Overall it's a good location but also very busy when traveling by car or shuttle. I'd recommend taking the BART from the airport if you have a choice. Also, you're going to pay for that location - it's fairly expensive. Rooms are small, but they have everything you need. Also close to trolley lines and buses, so public transport to Pier 39, ATT Park, and other sites is easy. The concierge service was great, and they also offer a free internet service in the lobby to print your boarding passes for flights which was a nice touch. After surveying the neighborhood on foot I'd have probably stayed somewhere else and saved a few bucks, but if you're just in town for a night or two it just might be worth it to book your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, really great customer service & great location.”
Reviews.Author: vpope
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the best hotels I ever stayed in. Really friendly staff that pays attention to your every need (they even gave us a free bottle of wine & upgraded our room for our birthdays). All in all, it was definitely the icing on the cake for a memorable stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “very well located in SF, good services”
Reviews.Author: lesver28
Reviews.Content: We appreciated a lot the location of the hotel, at the gate of china town in SF and close to the main areas of interest ; close to union square, 15 mn walking from the piers, close to stores for shopping, 10 mn walking from rental cars. A good french restaurant is just near the hotel on the same side. All the area is safe to walk with the family. The services were good and the welcome warm. The hotel is decorated in a nice and original way. No breakfast but there is a starbuck just on the other side of the street. Just one thing : the room is not very large for a family (we were three).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern but tiiiiny!”
Reviews.Author: Italiansinireland
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel an average rate because: - it is in a good location (you can walk to Union Square and the Chinese quarter), there are many nice restaurants nearby (one of them is the French one just beside) - I loved the hall, it is modern but at the same time has a quicky feeling that is just cool, not too much. You can grab some apples and often there is a woman reading cards... as I said it's quicky enough but in a good way. - The rooms are modern, I loved that I could plug in mu ipod/iphone and listen to my music, however, the rooms are sooo tiny.... I know it is in line with the stardands of the city but it's a bit exagerate! (I've been to other hotels in SF and had much bigger rooms). - it's quite pricey for what it offers, I mean, nothing is included and rooms are claustrophobic. -Last day we had to print our flight booking and they wouldn't allow us to print as they didn;t have a PC for guests. it was kind of an emergency and after soooo long they have printed it for us BUT we had to PAY for each sheet of paper printed. i found this disappointing as in exceptional circumstances, they should have helped as they could. Overall, you can find hotels with bigger rooms but if you like a modern and quicky feeling, being in the centre of the city, this is for you. Just go with the right expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but I Question Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mcal3K
Reviews.Content: Nice location right across the street from the Gates of China Town (corner of Grant and Bush). Also there are a couple of lovely "alleys" nearby that have been converted to French-style rues--like cafe-lined narrow streets in Paris. Still, there is lots of traffic outside and the rooms can be noisy late at night. Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent in that regard. And there's free coffee offered in the lobby during morning hours (7:30 to 9:30, I think.) The rooms, though, were just OK. In fact, our "king eco suite" seemed a bit like a budget room as far as size, decor, and bathroom. You had to move aside to close the bathroom door and be able to use the toilet. There was no way to swing the door shut without a careful maneuver--it was that cramped. The tired shag carpet wasn't appealing, but the bed was definitely comfortable. The old-fashioned window air-conditioner didn't quite cut it in terms of efficiency or looks. And I was told that this room was an upgrade . . . So--I question the value per dollar. For $250ish I felt the room was too expensive. I've stayed there during off season for much less, and I won't choose this hotel again unless there is a price incentive.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay great”
Reviews.Author: Pchips
Reviews.Content: This was the second annual trip in February. The staff remembered us, they honoured a free breakfast I won in a draw from the year before. The morning coffee and the late afternoon wine is a treat ( cookies in the afternoon are nice to). The room was a little tired but comfortable, we asked for a quiter room then the year before and lo and behold it was quiter. Rates are great in Feb, a little too high in the summer, too bad as we liked it. I must add that the location is the best. 10-15m walk to North Beach, 8m to Bart, close to great restaurants and Embarcadero, I am sure if we return in Feb we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBumps
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Triton. The staff were very professional and helpful. The hotel's in a great location for shopping and eating (try The Irish Bank around the corner) and it's right outside of China Town. There's free coffee and tea every morning as well as valet parking. My room was in excellent shape, clean, and well stocked. I'd stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: 123sunseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, decor was really cool and was greeted at check in with freshly baked cookies. Had the corner room which was a little noisy but made up for with the great view. Bed was really comfy also got starbucks breakfast included in price. Would really recommend this hotel for friendliness, price and somewhere unusual to stay.

Reviews.Title: “dont go for zen room”
Reviews.Author: daisymay08
Reviews.Content: We had booked a zen room at the triton, we did not know it was a futon that was put against the wall, ok for young ones but hopeless and impossible to get into or sleep in for 65 plus. Be careful. Hotel clean and in a good position with free coffe in the morning but take heed ,ask for large room and pay extra if you want to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “retro pop culture in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: Much like all other reviews, I cannot speak highly enough of the staff; they were extremely friendly and helpful! . The lobby and public areas are fantastically decorated.
